tournament.name: Tuesday 6th Qualifier for MagicFest Online Season 2

decks.notes: The deck focuses on controlling the board by utilizing the Fires of Invention enchantment to cast spells for free. It includes a mix of powerful planeswalkers like Teferi, Time Raveler and Narset of the Ancient Way, along with versatile creatures like Bonecrusher Giant and Cavalier of Flame to maintain board presence and answer threats. The deck aims to outvalue opponents with card advantage from cards like Sphinx of Foresight and Elspeth Conquers Death while using Keruga, the Macrosage as a companion to draw additional cards.

The main focus of this deck is to control the board and disrupt your opponent's strategies while also generating card advantage through blink effects. By utilizing cards like Thassa, Deep-Dwelling and Agent of Treachery, you can repeatedly steal your opponent's cards and apply pressure while also protecting your own threats with Teferi, Time Raveler. The deck also includes powerful sweepers like Time Wipe and Shatter the Sky to help stabilize the board and keep your opponents in check. Overall, the key strategy is to outvalue your opponent and maintain control of the game.

The deck aims to control the game by utilizing cards like Teferi, Time Raveler, Narset, Parter of Veils, and Agent of Treachery to disrupt the opponent's strategy. It also focuses on ramping up mana quickly with cards like Growth Spiral and Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath. Shatter the Sky and Shark Typhoon provide board control and create additional threats. The addition of Yorion, Sky Nomad as a companion allows for extra value and card advantage. The deck values consistency and long-term advantage over fast aggression.

The deck focuses on using a wide range of control tools to slow down the opponent's aggression while generating card advantage and mana advantage through cards like Teferi, Nissa, and Uro. The deck also includes a lot of card draw and recursion abilities to outvalue the opponent in the late game. Key cards like Shatter the Sky and Shark Typhoon help control the board and provide threats when needed. Overall, the deck's strategy revolves around outlasting the opponent and grinding them out through a combination of removal, card advantage, and powerful threats.

The deck focuses on using cycling cards to quickly cycle through the deck and trigger abilities that benefit from cycling. The goal is to create a fast-paced aggressive strategy that utilizes cards like Flourishing Fox and Zenith Flare to deal damage to the opponent while maintaining card advantage through cycling. The companion card Lurrus of the Dream-Den provides additional value by allowing the player to recur creatures from their graveyard. This deck seeks to overwhelm the opponent with a high volume of low-cost, cycling cards.

This deck focuses on quickly bringing out low-cost creatures with evasion abilities to deal direct damage to the opponent. By using cards such as Sea-Dasher Octopus and Brazen Borrower, the player can bypass blockers and control the board while pressuring the opponent's life total. The inclusion of cards like Dirge Bat and Insatiable Hemophage adds control elements and ensures that the deck can deal with threats efficiently. Overall, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a fast-paced, aggressive strategy while maintaining some degree of control over the game.

The deck focuses on utilizing Fires of Invention to quickly cast powerful spells without tapping mana. It includes a mix of Triome lands for color fixing and consistency. The key strategy is to control the board using removal spells like Tyrant's Scorn and Deafening Clarion, while also generating advantage with cards like Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath and Niv-Mizzet Reborn. The companion Yorion, Sky Nomad provides additional value by flickering permanents for extra ETB effects. Overall, the deck aims to outvalue opponents with a strong control game plan.

The deck focuses on controlling the board with powerful spells and creatures while leveraging Fires of Invention to cast multiple spells each turn without tapping mana. It aims to maintain control of the game through cards like Teferi, Time Raveler and Deafening Clarion, while also using powerful creatures like Cavalier of Flame and Sphinx of Foresight to close out the game. The deck emphasizes resource management and timing in order to out-value and out-tempo opponents, ultimately leading to victory.

The deck focuses on utilizing Fires of Invention to cast powerful spells for free, while controlling the board with removal and card advantage. The goal is to establish a strong board presence with large threats like Sphinx of Foresight and Cavalier of Flame, while also disrupting the opponent's strategy with Teferi, Time Raveler and Narset of the Ancient Way. The deck aims to outvalue and outlast opponents through a combination of control and tempo plays, ultimately overwhelming them with powerful creatures and card advantage.

The deck focuses on utilizing Fires of Invention to cast powerful spells for free, while controlling the board with removal spells like Deafening Clarion. The deck includes high-impact creatures like Cavalier of Flame and Sphinx of Foresight, along with planeswalkers like Teferi, Time Raveler and Narset of the Ancient Way for additional control and card advantage. The goal is to establish a dominant board presence and overwhelm the opponent with a mix of creatures, direct damage, and card advantage, ultimately securing the win through superior board control and powerful threats.

The deck focuses on utilizing the Fires of Invention enchantment to cast powerful spells for free, while also controlling the board using a combination of creatures and removal spells. The key strategy is to ramp up mana quickly with cards like Arboreal Grazer and Ketria Triome, and then play high-impact threats like Quartzwood Crasher and Questing Beast. The deck also includes Kaheera, the Orphanguard as a companion for additional synergy with its creature choices. Overall, the deck aims to overwhelm opponents with large threats and removal, while maintaining control of the game.

The deck revolves around using Fires of Invention to cast powerful spells for free, allowing the player to control the board and outvalue their opponent. The deck also includes a high amount of card advantage engines like Narset, Teferi, and Tamiyo, as well as threats like Uro and Shark Typhoon. The inclusion of Fae of Wishes allows for versatility in grabbing specific answers from the sideboard to deal with different situations. The deck aims to stall the game until it can overwhelm the opponent with its powerful spells and threats.

The deck focuses on quickly cycling through cards to create a strong board presence and deal damage to the opponent. It takes advantage of cards that reward cycling, such as Flourishing Fox and Improbable Alliance, while also using Zenith Flare as a finisher. The main strategy is to cycle through the deck, building up tokens and gaining life until a big Zenith Flare can end the game in a single turn. The companion Lurrus of the Dream-Den provides additional value by allowing players to continuously play low-cost permanents from the graveyard.

This Rakdos Aggro deck focuses on dealing damage quickly and efficiently through creature sacrifice combos and aggressive creatures. By utilizing cards like Claim the Firstborn, Whisper Squad, and Witch's Oven, the deck aims to control the board and overwhelm the opponent with damage. With the added restriction of only being able to have odd-converted mana cost cards in the deck due to Obosh, the Preypiercer as a companion, the deck's strategy becomes even more streamlined and focused on dealing damage in multiples of two.

This deck revolves around using aggressive creatures like Knight of the Ebon Legion and Mayhem Devil, along with sacrifice effects from Cauldron Familiar and Woe Strider to control the board and chip away at the opponent's life total. The companion Obosh, the Preypiercer provides a boost to damage output by focusing on odd converted mana costs. With cards like Witch's Oven and Claim the Firstborn to disrupt the opponent's strategy, this deck aims to maintain pressure and close out games quickly through aggressive plays and synergy between its creatures and spells.

The deck focuses on generating value through card advantage, ramp, and powerful threats while controlling the opponent's board with removal and counterspells. It aims to outvalue the opponent by constantly drawing cards, ramping into powerful spells, and disrupting their game plan. This deck is all about resource management, tempo control, and overwhelming the opponent with its versatile card pool and strong late-game threats. It excels in grinding out victories through attrition and overwhelming the opponent with incremental advantage.

This UW Control deck focuses on using a high number of board wipes and counterspells to maintain board control and disrupt the opponent's game plan. Narset and Teferi help with card advantage and tempo, while Elspeth Conquers Death provides removal and recursion. Shark Typhoon and Dream Trawler offer win conditions and card advantage. The deck also includes Yorion as a companion for additional value. The mana base is optimized for consistency and a variety of lands provide utility. Overall, the deck aims to control the game until it can establish a strong board presence and win.

The deck focuses on controlling the opponent's actions through counterspells, removal, and card advantage. It aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan with cards like Teferi, Time Raveler and Narset, Parter of Veils, while also generating card advantage and maintaining board presence with cards like Dream Trawler and Shark Typhoon. The deck utilizes a mixture of counterspells, removal spells, and card draw to control the board and stabilize the game until it can win with powerful finishers like Dream Trawler and Shark Typhoon.

This deck aims to quickly flood the board with creatures and utilize Winota's ability to cheat powerful creatures into play. The key strategy is to use cards like Raise the Alarm, Legion Warboss, and Hanged Executioner to create multiple creature tokens, triggering Winota's ability to put high-impact creatures like Agent of Treachery into play for free. The deck also includes Teferi, Time Raveler to protect against removal and disrupt opponent's plays. Overall, the deck focuses on overwhelming the opponent with aggressive creature plays and powerful Winota triggers to quickly secure victory.
